card.name: Æther Snap
card.ability: Remove all counters from all permanents and exile all tokens.
card.flavor:
"May you wake to find you were only ever a dream."
—Mephidross curse
card.ruling:
12/1/2004 : AEther Snap removes all counters from permanents, no matter what kind they are.
12/1/2004 : Counters on objects that aren't permanents, such as time counters on a suspended card or poison counters on a player, are unaffected by AEther Snap.

card.name: Æther Vial
card.ability:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a charge counter on Æther Vial.
{T}: You may put a creature card with converted mana cost equal to the number of charge counters on Æther Vial from your hand onto the battlefield.

card.name: Ageless Entity
card.ability: Whenever you gain life, put that many +1/+1 counters on Ageless Entity.
card.flavor: Tel-Jilad's sworn protectors are the trolls, yet more fearsome protectors were created by the Tangle itself.

card.name: Angel's Feather
card.ability: Whenever a player casts a white spell, you may gain 1 life.
card.flavor: If taken, it cuts the hand that clutches it. If given, it heals the hand that holds it.
card.ruling:
10/1/2009 : The ability triggers whenever any player, not just you, casts a white spell.
10/1/2009 : If a player casts a white spell, Angel's Feather's ability triggers and is put on the stack on top of that spell. Angel's Feather's ability will resolve (causing you to gain 1 life) before the spell does.

card.name: Arcane Spyglass
card.ability:
{2}, {T}, Sacrifice a land: Draw a card and put a charge counter on Arcane Spyglass.
Remove three charge counters from Arcane Spyglass: Draw a card.
card.flavor: It breaches not physical distances but temporal ones.

card.name: Arcbound Bruiser
card.ability: Modular 3 (This enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it. When it dies, you may put its +1/+1 counters on target artifact creature.)
card.flavor: Break in case of emergency.
card.ruling: 9/25/2006 : If an Arcbound creature gets enough -1/-1 counters to make its toughness 0 or cause the damage on it to now be lethal, the Modular ability will still give another artifact creature a number of +1/+1 counters equal to the number the Arcbound creature had before it got -1/-1 counters.

card.name: Arcbound Crusher
card.ability:
Trample
Whenever another artifact enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on Arcbound Crusher.
Modular 1 (This enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it. When it dies, you may put its +1/+1 counters on target artifact creature.)
card.ruling: 9/25/2006 : If an Arcbound creature gets enough -1/-1 counters to make its toughness 0 or cause the damage on it to now be lethal, the Modular ability will still give another artifact creature a number of +1/+1 counters equal to the number the Arcbound creature had before it got -1/-1 counters.

card.name: Arcbound Fiend
card.ability:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may move a +1/+1 counter from target creature onto Arcbound Fiend.
Modular 3 (This enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it. When it dies, you may put its +1/+1 counters on target artifact creature.)
card.ruling:
12/1/2004 : The creature that's targeted by Arcbound Fiend's middle ability doesn't have to have any +1/+1 counters on it. If it doesn't have a counter on it when the ability resolves, nothing happens.
9/25/2006 : If an Arcbound creature gets enough -1/-1 counters to make its toughness 0 or cause the damage on it to now be lethal, the Modular ability will still give another artifact creature a number of +1/+1 counters equal to the number the Arcbound creature had before it got -1/-1 counters.

card.name: Arcbound Hybrid
card.ability:
Haste
Modular 2 (This enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it. When it dies, you may put its +1/+1 counters on target artifact creature.)
card.ruling: 9/25/2006 : If an Arcbound creature gets enough -1/-1 counters to make its toughness 0 or cause the damage on it to now be lethal, the Modular ability will still give another artifact creature a number of +1/+1 counters equal to the number the Arcbound creature had before it got -1/-1 counters.

card.name: Arcbound Lancer
card.ability:
First strike
Modular 4 (This enters the battlefield with four +1/+1 counters on it. When it dies, you may put its +1/+1 counters on target artifact creature.)
card.ruling: 9/25/2006 : If an Arcbound creature gets enough -1/-1 counters to make its toughness 0 or cause the damage on it to now be lethal, the Modular ability will still give another artifact creature a number of +1/+1 counters equal to the number the Arcbound creature had before it got -1/-1 counters.

card.name: Arcbound Overseer
card.ability:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on each creature with modular you control.
Modular 6 (This enters the battlefield with six +1/+1 counters on it. When it dies, you may put its +1/+1 counters on target artifact creature.)
card.ruling: 9/25/2006 : If an Arcbound creature gets enough -1/-1 counters to make its toughness 0 or cause the damage on it to now be lethal, the Modular ability will still give another artifact creature a number of +1/+1 counters equal to the number the Arcbound creature had before it got -1/-1 counters.

card.name: Arcbound Ravager
card.ability:
Sacrifice an artifact: Put a +1/+1 counter on Arcbound Ravager.
Modular 1 (This enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it. When it dies, you may put its +1/+1 counters on target artifact creature.)
card.ruling: 9/25/2006 : If an Arcbound creature gets enough -1/-1 counters to make its toughness 0 or cause the damage on it to now be lethal, the Modular ability will still give another artifact creature a number of +1/+1 counters equal to the number the Arcbound creature had before it got -1/-1 counters.

card.name: Arcbound Reclaimer
card.ability:
Remove a +1/+1 counter from Arcbound Reclaimer: Put target artifact card from your graveyard on top of your library.
Modular 2 (This enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it. When it dies, you may put its +1/+1 counters on target artifact creature.)
card.ruling: 9/25/2006 : If an Arcbound creature gets enough -1/-1 counters to make its toughness 0 or cause the damage on it to now be lethal, the Modular ability will still give another artifact creature a number of +1/+1 counters equal to the number the Arcbound creature had before it got -1/-1 counters.

card.name: Arcbound Slith
card.ability:
Whenever Arcbound Slith deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
Modular 1 (This enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it. When it dies, you may put its +1/+1 counters on target artifact creature.)
card.ruling: 9/25/2006 : If an Arcbound creature gets enough -1/-1 counters to make its toughness 0 or cause the damage on it to now be lethal, the Modular ability will still give another artifact creature a number of +1/+1 counters equal to the number the Arcbound creature had before it got -1/-1 counters.

card.name: Arcbound Stinger
card.ability:
Flying
Modular 1 (This enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it. When it dies, you may put its +1/+1 counters on target artifact creature.)
card.ruling: 9/25/2006 : If an Arcbound creature gets enough -1/-1 counters to make its toughness 0 or cause the damage on it to now be lethal, the Modular ability will still give another artifact creature a number of +1/+1 counters equal to the number the Arcbound creature had before it got -1/-1 counters.

card.name: Arcbound Worker
card.ability: Modular 1 (This enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it. When it dies, you may put its +1/+1 counters on target artifact creature.)
card.flavor: The parts are as strong as the whole.
card.ruling: 9/25/2006 : If an Arcbound creature gets enough -1/-1 counters to make its toughness 0 or cause the damage on it to now be lethal, the Modular ability will still give another artifact creature a number of +1/+1 counters equal to the number the Arcbound creature had before it got -1/-1 counters.

card.name: Auriok Glaivemaster
card.ability: As long as Auriok Glaivemaster is equipped, it gets +1/+1 and has first strike.
card.flavor: "Give me a bit of steel and I'll deliver it into the hearts of my enemies."

card.name: Auriok Siege Sled
card.ability:
{1}: Target artifact creature blocks Auriok Siege Sled this turn if able.
{1}: Target artifact creature can't block Auriok Siege Sled this turn.
card.flavor: Everything in its path is either pushed aside or ground under.
card.ruling: 12/1/2004 : Remember that  an effect that says you "can't" do something overrides an effect that says you can or must do something. If you activate both of Auriok Siege Sled's abilities on the same creature, that creature can't block Auriok Siege Sled this turn.

card.name: Barbed Lightning
card.ability:
Choose one — Barbed Lightning deals 3 damage to target creature; or Barbed Lightning deals 3 damage to target player.
Entwine {2} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)
card.flavor: Every creature on Mirrodin is a lightning rod.

card.name: Blinkmoth Nexus
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{1}: Blinkmoth Nexus becomes a 1/1 Blinkmoth artifact creature with flying until end of turn. It's still a land.
{1}, {T}: Target Blinkmoth creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.ruling:
12/1/2004 : Blinkmoth Nexus gains the creature type "Blinkmoth" when it becomes a creature. This means that it ends up with three types (land, artifact, and creature), plus one creature subtype (Blinkmoth).
12/1/2004 : The "target Blinkmoth gets +1/+1" ability can target any creature with the creature type Blinkmoth.
12/1/2004 : If Blinkmoth Nexus is turned into a Forest after it's turned into a creature, it ends up with three types (artifact, land, and creature), plus one creature subtype (Blinkmoth) and one land subtype (Forest).
8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.
10/1/2009 : The layering rules have changed. Now if you animate a land and its power and toughness are lowered by Mutilate or a similar effect, reactivating the land's ability won't reset the values. This is because you apply all effects that set power and toughness to specific values before you apply any that modify power and toughness, regardless of the order in which the effects resolve.

card.name: Burden of Greed
card.ability: Target player loses 1 life for each tapped artifact he or she controls.
card.flavor:
"The one who dies with the most toys is still dead."
—Geth, keeper of the Vault

card.name: Carry Away
card.ability:
Enchant Equipment
When Carry Away enters the battlefield, unattach enchanted Equipment.
You control enchanted Equipment.
card.flavor: Stealing goblin weapons would be easier if the goblins were smart enough to let go.
card.ruling: 12/1/2004 : Normally, gaining control of an Equipment doesn't change what it's attached to. However, Carry Away has a triggered ability that unattaches the Equipment from whatever it's attached to. The Equipment's new controller can activate its equip ability to move it onto a creature he or she controls.

card.name: Chimeric Egg
card.ability:
Whenever an opponent casts a nonartifact spell, put a charge counter on Chimeric Egg.
Remove three charge counters from Chimeric Egg: Chimeric Egg becomes a 6/6 Construct artifact creature with trample until end of turn.
card.ruling: 8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.

card.name: Chittering Rats
card.ability: When Chittering Rats enters the battlefield, target opponent puts a card from his or her hand on top of his or her library.
card.flavor: Bottom feeders sometimes rise to the top.

card.name: Chromescale Drake
card.ability:
Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)
Flying
When Chromescale Drake enters the battlefield, reveal the top three cards of your library. Put all artifact cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.

card.name: Coretapper
card.ability:
{T}: Put a charge counter on target artifact.
Sacrifice Coretapper: Put two charge counters on target artifact.
card.flavor: It converts the faintest surges of power from Mirrodin's core into usable energy, providing endless power for Memnarch's creations on the surface.

card.name: Crazed Goblin
card.ability: Crazed Goblin attacks each turn if able.
card.flavor: Because fighting is easier than figuring out what else to do.

card.name: Darksteel Brute
card.ability:
Darksteel Brute is indestructible. ("Destroy" effects and lethal damage don't destroy it.)
{3}: Darksteel Brute becomes a 2/2 Beast artifact creature until end of turn.
card.ruling: 8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.

card.name: Darksteel Citadel
card.ability:
Darksteel Citadel is indestructible. ("Destroy" effects and lethal damage don't destroy it.)
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: Panopticon, forge of the Darksteel Eye, home of Mirrodin's keeper.

card.name: Darksteel Colossus
card.ability:
Trample
Darksteel Colossus is indestructible.
If Darksteel Colossus would be put into a graveyard from anywhere, reveal Darksteel Colossus and shuffle it into its owner's library instead.
card.ruling: 10/1/2009 : Lethal damage, damage from a source with deathtouch, and effects that say "destroy" won't cause an indestructible creature to be put into the graveyard. However, an indestructible creature can be put into the graveyard for a number of reasons. The most likely reasons are if it's sacrificed or if its toughness is 0 or less. (In these cases, of course, Darksteel Colossus would be shuffled into its owner's library instead of being put into its owner's graveyard.)

card.name: Darksteel Forge
card.ability: Artifacts you control are indestructible. ("Destroy" effects and lethal damage don't destroy them.)
card.flavor:
"Did it have this shape upon Mirrodin's creation, or did some inconceivable force shape the unshapable?"
—Pontifex, elder researcher

card.name: Darksteel Gargoyle
card.ability:
Flying
Darksteel Gargoyle is indestructible. ("Destroy" effects and lethal damage don't destroy it.)
card.flavor: The ultimate treasure is one that guards itself.

card.name: Darksteel Ingot
card.ability:
Darksteel Ingot is indestructible. (Effects that say "destroy" don't destroy it.)
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

card.name: Darksteel Pendant
card.ability:
Darksteel Pendant is indestructible. ("Destroy" effects and lethal damage don't destroy it.)
{1}, {T}: Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.

card.name: Darksteel Reactor
card.ability:
Darksteel Reactor is indestructible. ("Destroy" effects and lethal damage don't destroy it.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a charge counter on Darksteel Reactor.
When Darksteel Reactor has twenty or more charge counters on it, you win the game.

card.name: Death Cloud
card.ability: Each player loses X life, discards X cards, sacrifices X creatures, then sacrifices X lands.
card.flavor: The swarm's million wings stir the foulest of breezes.

card.name: Death-Mask Duplicant
card.ability:
Imprint — {1}: Exile target creature card from your graveyard.
As long as a card exiled with Death-Mask Duplicant has flying, Death-Mask Duplicant has flying. The same is true for fear, first strike, double strike, haste, landwalk, protection, and trample.
card.ruling:
12/1/2004 : Death-Mask Duplicant has an activated imprint ability. This ability can be activated any number of times, so multiple creature cards can become imprinted on this creature.
12/1/2004 : Death-Mask Duplicant gains all landwalk and protection abilities of the imprinted creature cards. If Death-Mask Duplicant imprints a card with protection from red and a card with protection from creatures, it has protection from red and from creatures.

card.name: Demon's Horn
card.ability: Whenever a player casts a black spell, you may gain 1 life.
card.flavor: Its curve mimics the twists of life and death.
card.ruling:
10/1/2009 : The ability triggers whenever any player, not just you, casts a black spell.
10/1/2009 : If a player casts a black spell, Demon's Horn's ability triggers and is put on the stack on top of that spell. Demon's Horn's ability will resolve (causing you to gain 1 life) before the spell does.

card.name: Dismantle
card.ability: Destroy target artifact. If that artifact had counters on it, put that many +1/+1 counters or charge counters on an artifact you control.
card.flavor:
"If only the living were so easily salvaged."
—Memnarch
card.ruling:
12/1/2004 : Dismantle targets only the artifact that will be destroyed. When Dismantle resolves, you choose which type of counters you want and choose an artifact you control to put them on.
12/1/2004 : It doesn't matter what kind of counters the destroyed artifact had on it, only how many. If an artifact had five bomb counters and two trap counters on it, that converts to seven +1/+1 counters or seven charge counters.
12/1/2004 : You can put +1/+1 counters on a noncreature artifact. They won't do anything unless the artifact becomes a creature, at which time they'll add to the creature's power and toughness.
12/1/2004 : If the artifact regenerates or is indestructible, it won't be destroyed, but you still put the appropriate number of counters onto an artifact you control.

card.name: Dragon's Claw
card.ability: Whenever a player casts a red spell, you may gain 1 life.
card.flavor: Though no longer attached to the hand, it still holds its adversary in its grasp.
card.ruling:
10/1/2009 : The ability triggers whenever any player, not just you, casts a red spell.
10/1/2009 : If a player casts a red spell, Dragon's Claw's ability triggers and is put on the stack on top of that spell. Dragon's Claw's ability will resolve (causing you to gain 1 life) before the spell does.

card.name: Drill-Skimmer
card.ability:
Flying
Drill-Skimmer has shroud as long as you control another artifact creature. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
card.flavor: In close proximity, their magnetic energies merge and form a field of protection.

card.name: Drooling Ogre
card.ability: Whenever a player casts an artifact spell, that player gains control of Drooling Ogre. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
card.flavor:
"Is it the stomping kind or the munching kind?"
—Slobad, goblin tinkerer

card.name: Dross Golem
card.ability:
Affinity for Swamps (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each Swamp you control.)
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
card.flavor: The longer it skulks through the corrosive gases of Mephidross, the more it adopts their thirst for death.

card.name: Eater of Days
card.ability:
Flying, trample
When Eater of Days enters the battlefield, you skip your next two turns.
card.flavor: When Mirrodin's varied civilizations developed ways to fight the levelers, Memnarch upped the stakes.

card.name: Echoing Calm
card.ability: Destroy target enchantment and all other enchantments with the same name as that enchantment.
card.flavor: A single light unleashes a hail of cleansing.

card.name: Echoing Courage
card.ability: Target creature and all other creatures with the same name as that creature get +2/+2 until end of turn.
card.flavor: A single seed unleashes a flurry of growth.

card.name: Echoing Decay
card.ability: Target creature and all other creatures with the same name as that creature get -2/-2 until end of turn.
card.flavor: A single fear unleashes a torrent of nightmares.

card.name: Echoing Ruin
card.ability: Destroy target artifact and all other artifacts with the same name as that artifact.
card.flavor: A single misstep unleashes an avalanche of ruin.

card.name: Echoing Truth
card.ability: Return target nonland permanent and all other permanents with the same name as that permanent to their owners' hands.
card.flavor: A single lie unleashes a tide of disbelief.

card.name: Emissary of Despair
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Emissary of Despair deals combat damage to a player, that player loses 1 life for each artifact he or she controls.

card.name: Emissary of Hope
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Emissary of Hope deals combat damage to a player, you gain 1 life for each artifact that player controls.

card.name: Essence Drain
card.ability: Essence Drain deals 3 damage to target creature or player and you gain 3 life.
card.flavor: Mephidross claims all life within it. What cannot be twisted is absorbed.
card.ruling: 7/1/2012 : If the target creature or player is an illegal target when Essence Drain tries to resolve, it will be countered and none of its effects will happen. You won't gain 3 life.

card.name: Fangren Firstborn
card.ability: Whenever Fangren Firstborn attacks, put a +1/+1 counter on each attacking creature.
card.flavor: In the Tangle, bad is often followed by worse.

card.name: Fireball
card.ability:
Fireball deals X damage divided evenly, rounded down, among any number of target creatures and/or players.
Fireball costs {1} more to cast for each target beyond the first.
card.flavor: The spell fell upon the crowd like a dragon, ancient and full of death.
card.ruling:
12/1/2004 : The additional cost is paid when you pay the rest of Fireball's costs, even though that text appears second on the card (to make the card easier to read). The additional cost doesn't count toward Fireball's converted mana cost.
12/1/2004 : If, for example, X is 5 and you choose three target creatures, Fireball has a total cost of {7}{R} (even though its mana cost is just {5}{R}). If those creatures are all still legal targets as Fireball resolves, it deals 1 damage to each of them.
5/1/2009 : You may cast Fireball with zero targets, regardless of the value chosen for X. If you do so, it will not be a targeted spell, and no damage will actually be dealt when it resolves.
10/1/2009 : Fireball's damage is divided as Fireball resolves, not as it's cast, because there are no choices involved. The division involves only targets that are still legal at that time.
10/1/2009 : You can target more than X creatures. However, if the number of legal targets at the time Fireball resolves is greater than X, none of them will be dealt any damage.

card.name: Flamebreak
card.ability: Flamebreak deals 3 damage to each creature without flying and each player. Creatures dealt damage this way can't be regenerated this turn.
card.flavor:
"Now I'm thirsty."
—Korva, Vulshok battlemaster

card.name: Furnace Dragon
card.ability:
Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)
Flying
When Furnace Dragon enters the battlefield, if you cast it from your hand, exile all artifacts.

card.name: Gemini Engine
card.ability: Whenever Gemini Engine attacks, put a colorless Construct artifact creature token named Twin onto the battlefield attacking. Its power is equal to Gemini Engine's power and its toughness is equal to Gemini Engine's toughness. Sacrifice the token at end of combat.
card.ruling:
12/1/2004 : The Twin token enters the battlefield as an untapped attacking creature. It's not subject to any costs to attack or restrictions on attacking.
12/1/2004 : The Twin token won't trigger any abilities that trigger "when [a creature] attacks."
12/1/2004 : The token's power and toughness are set equal to Gemini Engine's power and toughness. If there's a Glorious Anthem on the battlefield (which gives your creatures +1/+1), Gemini Engine is 4/5. The Twin token starts as a 4/5, and then the Anthem gives it +1/+1, making the Twin a 5/6 creature.
12/1/2004 : Once the token has been created, its power and toughness aren't dependent on Gemini Engine's power and toughness, and they won't change if Gemini Engine's power and toughness change.

card.name: Genesis Chamber
card.ability: Whenever a nontoken creature enters the battlefield, if Genesis Chamber is untapped, that creature's controller puts a 1/1 colorless Myr artifact creature token onto the battlefield.
card.flavor:
"As the experimental population grows, so do the number of myr. It's a perfect equilibrium."
—Memnarch

card.name: Geth's Grimoire
card.ability: Whenever an opponent discards a card, you may draw a card.
card.flavor: The book shrieks horribly until its cover is opened, granting the spirit inside a moment's rest from the painful stirrings of the book's contents.

card.name: Goblin Archaeologist
card.ability: {R}, {T}: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, destroy target artifact and untap Goblin Archaeologist. If you lose the flip, sacrifice Goblin Archaeologist.
card.flavor: Always easily impressed, Durg was about to be blown away.

card.name: Greater Harvester
card.ability:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a permanent.
Whenever Greater Harvester deals combat damage to a player, that player sacrifices two permanents.

card.name: Grimclaw Bats
card.ability:
Flying
{B}, Pay 1 life: Grimclaw Bats gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: Even on a world of metal, there are those who thirst for blood.

card.name: Hallow
card.ability: Prevent all damage target spell would deal this turn. You gain life equal to the damage prevented this way.
card.flavor: "Bend with the storm, then reply in kind."

card.name: Heartseeker
card.ability:
Equipped creature gets +2/+1 and has "{T}, Unattach Heartseeker: Destroy target creature."
Equip {5} ({5}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery. This card enters the battlefield unattached and stays on the battlefield if the creature leaves.)
card.ruling:
12/1/2004 : Heartseeker grants an ability to the equipped creature. The ability can target a creature with protection from artifacts (unless the equipped creature is an artifact creature).
12/1/2004 : The equipped creature's controller chooses whether or not to activate the activated ability. It doesn't matter who controls Heartseeker.
12/1/2004 : "Unattach Heartseeker" means just that -- Heartseeker moves off the creature it was equipping and remains on the battlefield.

card.name: Hoverguard Observer
card.ability:
Flying
Hoverguard Observer can block only creatures with flying.
card.flavor: It could be made to run silently, but its low hum reminds the Neurok that they are always watched.

card.name: Hunger of the Nim
card.ability: Target creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn for each artifact you control.
card.flavor: Their pain is so great, they can't help but share it with others.

card.name: Infested Roothold
card.ability:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Protection from artifacts
Whenever an opponent casts an artifact spell, you may put a 1/1 green Insect creature token onto the battlefield.

card.name: Inflame
card.ability: Inflame deals 2 damage to each creature dealt damage this turn.
card.flavor: A Vulshok weapon strikes with the fire of the forge that made it.

card.name: Juggernaut
card.ability:
Juggernaut attacks each turn if able.
Juggernaut can't be blocked by Walls.
card.flavor: The goblins built it far larger than the cave opening, but to their glee, it smashed into the mountainside, ripping itself a new exit.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : An effect that states "Enchanted creature can only be blocked by Walls" will make the Juggernaut unblockable. The "can only be blocked by walls" effect doesn't override the text on the Juggernaut's ability.
10/4/2004 : There is no penalty if for some reason the Juggernaut can't attack, but if it can attack you must do so.
8/15/2010 : If, during your declare attackers step, Juggernaut is tapped, is affected by a spell or ability that says it can't attack, or is affected by "summoning sickness," then it doesn't attack. If there's a cost associated with having Juggernaut attack, you aren't forced to pay that cost, so it doesn't have to attack in that case either.
8/15/2010 : If there are multiple combat phases in a turn, Juggernaut must attack only in the first one in which it's able to.

card.name: Karstoderm
card.ability:
Karstoderm enters the battlefield with five +1/+1 counters on it.
Whenever an artifact enters the battlefield, remove a +1/+1 counter from Karstoderm.

card.name: Kraken's Eye
card.ability: Whenever a player casts a blue spell, you may gain 1 life.
card.flavor: Bright as a mirror, dark as the sea.
card.ruling:
10/1/2009 : The ability triggers whenever any player, not just you, casts a blue spell.
10/1/2009 : If a player casts a blue spell, Kraken's Eye's ability triggers and is put on the stack on top of that spell. Kraken's Eye's ability will resolve (causing you to gain 1 life) before the spell does.

card.name: Krark-Clan Stoker
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice an artifact: Add {R}{R} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: Fallen enemies are fed to the scavengers. Fallen friends are thrown into the Great Furnace, their souls returned to the Great Mother.

card.name: Last Word
card.ability:
Last Word can't be countered by spells or abilities.
Counter target spell.
card.flavor: "Someday, someone will best me. But it won't be today, and it won't be you."

card.name: Leonin Battlemage
card.ability:
{T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
Whenever you cast a spell, you may untap Leonin Battlemage.
card.flavor: The strongest of the pride are measured not by the steel in their hands but by the steel in their souls.

card.name: Leonin Bola
card.ability:
Equipped creature has "{T}, Unattach Leonin Bola: Tap target creature."
Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery. This card enters the battlefield unattached and stays on the battlefield if the creature leaves.)
card.ruling:
12/1/2004 : Leonin Bola grants an ability to the equipped creature. The ability can target a creature with protection from artifacts (unless the equipped creature is an artifact creature).
12/1/2004 : The equipped creature's controller chooses whether or not to activate the activated ability. It doesn't matter who controls Leonin Bola.
12/1/2004 : "Unattach Leonin Bola" means just that -- Leonin Bola moves off the creature it was equipping and remains on the battlefield.

card.name: Leonin Shikari
card.ability: You may activate equip abilities any time you could cast an instant.
card.flavor: Her instinct is as sharp as her blade.
card.ruling:
12/1/2004 : An equip ability uses the keyword ability "equip." Normally, equip abilities can be activated only any time you could cast a Sorcery.
12/1/2004 : Leonin Shikari allows you to move your Equipment around during the combat phase or in response to a spell or ability. You're still subject to any other restrictions on activating equip abilities.

card.name: Lich's Tomb
card.ability:
You don't lose the game for having 0 or less life.
Whenever you lose life, sacrifice a permanent for each 1 life you lost. (Damage causes loss of life.)

card.name: Loxodon Mystic
card.ability: {W}, {T}: Tap target creature.
card.flavor: As the nim storm across the plains, a lone priest stands in their path. At his silent gesture, the battle line breaks, and the tide turns.

card.name: Machinate
card.ability: Look at the top X cards of your library, where X is the number of artifacts you control. Put one of those cards into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
card.flavor: As long as there are questions to be asked, the vedalken will ask them.

card.name: Magnetic Flux
card.ability: Artifact creatures you control gain flying until end of turn.
card.flavor: After the researcher's astonishing success, his assistants spent six hours finding a way to return the specimens safely to the ground.

card.name: Memnarch
card.ability:
{1}{U}{U}: Target permanent becomes an artifact in addition to its other types. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
{3}{U}: Gain control of target artifact. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
card.flavor: In the blur between metal and flesh, Memnarch found madness.
card.ruling:
12/1/2004 : The effects of Memnarch's abilities don't end at end of turn, and they don't end when Memnarch leaves the battlefield. Both effects last until the affected permanent leaves the battlefield.
12/1/2004 : You can use the first ability on a nonartifact permanent, wait for the ability to resolve, and then use the second ability on that permanent.

card.name: Mephitic Ooze
card.ability:
Mephitic Ooze gets +1/+0 for each artifact you control.
Whenever Mephitic Ooze deals combat damage to a creature, destroy that creature. The creature can't be regenerated.
card.flavor: In Mephidross, refuse doesn't last long—it's all scavenged, reanimated, or consumed.

card.name: Metal Fatigue
card.ability: Tap all artifacts.
card.flavor: The Auriok have fought the metal hordes for so long now that knowing how to cripple them has become an instinct.

card.name: Mirrodin's Core
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Put a charge counter on Mirrodin's Core.
{T}, Remove a charge counter from Mirrodin's Core: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

card.name: Murderous Spoils
card.ability: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated. You gain control of all Equipment that was attached to it. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
card.flavor: Scavengers are always the first to pay their respects.

card.name: Mycosynth Lattice
card.ability:
All permanents are artifacts in addition to their other types.
All cards that aren't on the battlefield, spells, and permanents are colorless.
Players may spend mana as though it were mana of any color.
card.ruling:
12/1/2004 : Mycosynth Lattice turns all permanents on the battlefield into artifacts. Spells on the stack and cards in other zones aren't permanents, so those spells and cards don't become artifacts.
12/1/2004 : Mycosynth Lattice's second ability makes everything, in every zone of the game, colorless.
12/1/2004 : The Lattice's third ability lets players spend even colorless mana as though it had a color. However, it doesn't remove restrictions on the mana. For example, Mycosynth Lattice doesn't allow mana from Vedalken Engineer to be used to cast a nonartifact spell.
10/1/2009 : The Lattice's first ability causes Auras to become artifacts. Combined with March of the Machines from the Mirrodin set, this can then make those Auras become creatures. An Aura that's also a creature can't enchant anything. It's unattached the next time state-based actions are checked, and then immediately put into its owner's graveyard as a second state-based action.

card.name: Myr Landshaper
card.ability: {T}: Target land becomes an artifact in addition to its other types until end of turn.
card.flavor: One thing the myr can't do is enjoy the scenery.
card.ruling: 12/1/2004 : The land keeps all its other types, subtypes, and supertypes: If it was a basic land, it's still basic. If it was a Forest, it's still a Forest.

card.name: Myr Matrix
card.ability:
Myr Matrix is indestructible. ("Destroy" effects and lethal damage don't destroy it.)
Myr creatures get +1/+1.
{5}: Put a 1/1 colorless Myr artifact creature token onto the battlefield.

card.name: Myr Moonvessel
card.ability: When Myr Moonvessel dies, add {1} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: Memnarch created the myr with three qualities in mind: dependability, controllability, and disposability.
card.ruling: 1/25/2011 : You get the mana whether you want it or not. If you don't spend it, it will disappear at the end of the current step (or phase).

card.name: Nemesis Mask
card.ability:
All creatures able to block equipped creature do so.
Equip {3} ({3}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery. This card enters the battlefield unattached and stays on the battlefield if the creature leaves.)

card.name: Neurok Prodigy
card.ability:
Flying
Discard an artifact card: Return Neurok Prodigy to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: "Why should I be bound by rules when I can see so far beyond them?"

card.name: Neurok Transmuter
card.ability:
{U}: Target creature becomes an artifact in addition to its other types until end of turn.
{U}: Until end of turn, target artifact creature becomes blue and isn't an artifact.
card.ruling:
12/1/2004 : Neurok Transmuter's second ability removes the type "artifact" -- and any artifact subtypes -- from the artifact creature it targets. It doesn't remove any other types or any subtypes of other types, and it doesn't remove supertypes. If the artifact was Legendary, it's still Legendary, and the "Legendary rule" applies normally.
12/1/2004 : Equipment that stops being an artifact loses the subtype "Equipment." Permanents without the subtype Equipment can't equip creatures. Of course, artifact creatures can't equip anything either.
12/1/2004 : Neurok Transmuter's second ability interacts strangely with March of the Machines from the Mirrodin set. If an artifact is an artifact creature only because March of the Machines is on the battlefield and you then activate Neurok Transmuter's second ability on that artifact creature, the result is a permanent with no types whatsoever. Neurok Transmuter's ability removes the type "artifact." March of the Machines depends on knowing what is and isn't an artifact. The permanent won't be an artifact when March of the Machine's effect is applied and therefore it won't be turned into a creature.

card.name: Nim Abomination
card.ability: At the beginning of your end step, if Nim Abomination is untapped, you lose 3 life.
card.flavor: It is one of the oldest nim, steeped so long in the Dross that it has lost all vestiges of humanity.

card.name: Nourish
card.ability: You gain 6 life.
card.flavor: Gelfruit grows abundantly wherever Sylvok druids live, as if the Tangle knows that humans are not as hardy as the beasts or as nimble as the elves.

card.name: Oxidda Golem
card.ability:
Affinity for Mountains (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each Mountain you control.)
Haste
card.flavor: The longer it patrols the smoldering crags of the Oxidda Chain, the more it adopts their fiery temper.

card.name: Oxidize
card.ability: Destroy target artifact. It can't be regenerated.
card.flavor:
"Ashes to ashes, rust to rust."
—Viridian shaman

card.name: Panoptic Mirror
card.ability:
Imprint — {X}, {T}: You may exile an instant or sorcery card with converted mana cost X from your hand.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may copy a card exiled with Panoptic Mirror. If you do, you may cast the copy without paying its mana cost.
card.ruling:
12/1/2004 : As Panoptic Mirror's triggered ability resolves, it allows you to create a copy of one of the Instant or Sorcery cards imprinted on Panoptic Mirror in the Exile zone (that's where the imprinted card is) and then cast it without paying its mana cost.
12/1/2004 : You don't pay the spell's mana cost. If the spell has X in its mana cost, X is 0. You do pay any additional costs for that spell. You can't use any alternative costs.
12/1/2004 : The triggered ability triggers only once each upkeep, not once per imprinted card. If no cards are imprinted on Panoptic Mirror when the triggered ability resolves, it does nothing.
12/1/2004 : You may imprint a card on Panoptic Mirror in response to the upkeep-triggered ability. If you do, that card is available to copy when the triggered ability resolves.
12/1/2004 : Exiling  a card when the activated ability resolves is optional. If you choose to exile a card, you can exile only a card with converted mana cost equal to X.
12/1/2004 : To imprint a split card, you pay X equal to either side's converted mana cost. If the copied card is a split card, you choose which one side of it to cast, but you can't cast both sides. You can choose the other side later in the game, though.
3/1/2005 : The creation of the copy and then the casting of the copy are both optional.

card.name: Pristine Angel
card.ability:
Flying
As long as Pristine Angel is untapped, it has protection from artifacts and from all colors.
Whenever you cast a spell, you may untap Pristine Angel.

card.name: Psychic Overload
card.ability:
Enchant permanent
When Psychic Overload enters the battlefield, tap enchanted permanent.
Enchanted permanent doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
Enchanted permanent has "Discard two artifact cards: Untap this permanent."

card.name: Pteron Ghost
card.ability:
Flying
Sacrifice Pteron Ghost: Regenerate target artifact.
card.flavor: Defending to the death isn't always enough.

card.name: Pulse of the Dross
card.ability: Target player reveals three cards from his or her hand and you choose one of them. That player discards that card. Then if that player has more cards in hand than you, return Pulse of the Dross to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: Before tyrants or torturers, there was evil.

card.name: Pulse of the Fields
card.ability: You gain 4 life. Then if an opponent has more life than you, return Pulse of the Fields to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: Before religion or civilization, there was order.

card.name: Pulse of the Forge
card.ability: Pulse of the Forge deals 4 damage to target player. Then if that player has more life than you, return Pulse of the Forge to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: Before wars or weapons, there was anger.

card.name: Pulse of the Grid
card.ability: Draw two cards, then discard a card. Then if an opponent has more cards in hand than you, return Pulse of the Grid to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: Before labs or lectures, there was insight.

card.name: Pulse of the Tangle
card.ability: Put a 3/3 green Beast creature token onto the battlefield. Then if an opponent controls more creatures than you, return Pulse of the Tangle to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: Before predators or prey, there was life.

card.name: Purge
card.ability: Destroy target artifact creature or black creature. It can't be regenerated.
card.flavor: For the first and last time, the horrific creature experienced terror.

card.name: Quicksilver Behemoth
card.ability:
Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)
When Quicksilver Behemoth attacks or blocks, return it to its owner's hand at end of combat. (Return it only if it's on the battlefield.)

card.name: Razor Golem
card.ability:
Affinity for Plains (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each Plains you control.)
Vigilance
card.flavor: The longer it stands among the deadly blades of the Razor Fields, the more it adopts their harsh exterior.

card.name: Reap and Sow
card.ability:
Choose one — Destroy target land; or search your library for a land card, put that card onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.
Entwine {1}{G} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

card.name: Rebuking Ceremony
card.ability: Put two target artifacts on top of their owners' libraries.
card.flavor: From the Radix at the hub of the Tangle all the way out to the Edges of Forgetting, a Viridian elf's life is built around the temporary.
card.ruling: 12/1/2004 : If both cards are owned by the same player, that player decides their order on top of his or her library.

card.name: Reshape
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Reshape, sacrifice an artifact.
Search your library for an artifact card with converted mana cost X or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor:
"Today's paperweight, tomorrow's leveler."
—Bruenna, Neurok leader

card.name: Retract
card.ability: Return all artifacts you control to their owner's hand.
card.flavor:
"Secrets are meant to remain secret."
—Memnarch

card.name: Ritual of Restoration
card.ability: Return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: Leonin raising ceremonies take place at the white sun's dawn, the rebirth of artifacts mirroring the birth of a new day.

card.name: Roaring Slagwurm
card.ability: Whenever Roaring Slagwurm attacks, tap all artifacts.
card.flavor: Wurms compete for nesting grounds near the Radix. The young who hatch closest have the best chance for survival.

card.name: Savage Beating
card.ability:
Cast Savage Beating only during your turn and only during combat.
Choose one — Creatures you control gain double strike until end of turn; or untap all creatures you control and after this phase, there is an additional combat phase.
Entwine {1}{R} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)
card.ruling: 12/1/2004 : The additional combat phase is directly after the combat phase in which Savage Beating is cast. There isn't a main phase between the two combat phases.

card.name: Scavenging Scarab
card.ability: Scavenging Scarab can't block.
card.flavor: The beetles feed not on the flesh of corpses but on the metal, grinding out the iron and steel to add to their own bulky shells.

card.name: Screams from Within
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -1/-1.
When enchanted creature dies, return Screams from Within from your graveyard to the battlefield.
card.flavor: There's no escaping an enemy that lives inside your head.
card.ruling:
12/1/2004 : If another player has gained control of Screams from Within, its triggered ability does nothing when it's put into a graveyard. Cards are always put into their owner's graveyard, but Screams from Within's ability looks for the card only in its controller's graveyard.
8/1/2005 : If Screams from Within returns to the battlefield from your graveyard, you choose the creature that Screams from Within enchants (just as you would for any Aura that you're putting onto the battlefield without casting it). If your opponent doesn't control any creatures, you must choose one of your creatures. If there's nothing at all that Screams from Within can enchant, it remains in your graveyard.

card.name: Scrounge
card.ability: Target opponent chooses an artifact card in his or her graveyard. Put that card onto the battlefield under your control.
card.flavor: When leonin settlers abandon their homes to the nim, items of value are often left behind.

card.name: Second Sight
card.ability:
Choose one — Look at the top five cards of target opponent's library, then put them back in any order; or look at the top five cards of your library, then put them back in any order.
Entwine {U} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

card.name: Serum Powder
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
Any time you could mulligan and Serum Powder is in your hand, you may exile all the cards from your hand, then draw that many cards. (You can do this in addition to taking mulligans.)
card.ruling:
12/1/2004 : You can use Serum Powder's second ability only while it's in your hand. If this card is in your hand, you can choose either to mulligan or to use Serum Powder's ability. Using the ability doesn't prevent you from taking further mulligans, and taking a mulligan doesn't prevent you from using a Serum Powder's ability if you happen to draw one.
12/1/2004 : Unlike a normal mulligan, Serum Powder lets you draw the same number of cards that were in your hand, not one less. If you have already taken one mulligan and your hand contains six cards including a Serum Powder, you can choose to exile those six cards and draw six new cards.
12/1/2004 : The cards in your hand are exiled for the rest of the game; they aren't shuffled back into your library if you take another mulligan. Cards exiled are always face up unless the effect that exiled them says they aren't. Be sure to return those cards to your deck for your next game.

card.name: Shield of Kaldra
card.ability:
Equipment named Sword of Kaldra, Shield of Kaldra, and Helm of Kaldra are indestructible.
Equipped creature is indestructible. ("Destroy" effects and lethal damage don't destroy it.)
Equip {4}

card.name: Shriveling Rot
card.ability:
Choose one — Until end of turn, whenever a creature is dealt damage, destroy it; or until end of turn, whenever a creature dies, that creature's controller loses life equal to its toughness.
Entwine {2}{B} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

card.name: Shunt
card.ability: Change the target of target spell with a single target.
card.flavor: "You might want to work on your aim."
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Once the spell resolves, the new target is considered to be targeted by the deflected spell. This will trigger any effects which trigger on being targeted.
10/4/2004 : This only targets the spell being changed, not the original or new target of the spell it is affecting.
10/4/2004 : The target of a spell that targets another spell on the stack can be changed to any other spell on the stack, even if the new target will resolve before the spell does.
10/4/2004 : You can't make a spell which is on the stack target itself.
10/4/2004 : You can choose to make a spell on the stack target this spell (if such a target choice would be legal had the spell been cast while this spell was on the stack). The new target for the deflected spell is not chosen until this spell resolves. This spell is still on the stack when new targets are selected for the spell.
10/4/2004 : If there is no other legal target for the spell, this does not change the target.
10/4/2004 : This does not check if the current target is legal. It just checks if the spell has a single target.
10/4/2004 : You choose the spell to target on announcement, but you pick the new target for that spell on resolution.
7/15/2007 : If a spell targets multiple things, you can't target it with Shunt, even if all but one of those targets has become illegal.
7/15/2007 : If a spell targets the same player or object multiple times, you can't target it with Shunt.

card.name: Skullclamp
card.ability:
Equipped creature gets +1/-1.
Whenever equipped creature dies, draw two cards.
Equip {1}

card.name: Slobad, Goblin Tinkerer
card.ability: Sacrifice an artifact: Target artifact is indestructible this turn. ("Destroy" effects and lethal damage don't destroy that artifact.)
card.flavor:
"I used to joke that he had been exiled for being too smart. Now I know why he never laughed."
—Glissa Sunseeker
card.ruling: 12/1/2004 : Damage wears off simultaneously with this effect ending, so it does save an artifact creature from lethal damage.

card.name: Soulscour
card.ability: Destroy all nonartifact permanents.
card.flavor:
"I have seen the end of times, a future in which all our kind are torn from this world."
—Ushanti, leonin shaman

card.name: Spawning Pit
card.ability:
Sacrifice a creature: Put a charge counter on Spawning Pit.
{1}, Remove two charge counters from Spawning Pit: Put a 2/2 colorless Spawn artifact creature token onto the battlefield.

card.name: Specter's Shroud
card.ability:
Equipped creature gets +1/+0.
Whenever equipped creature deals combat damage to a player, that player discards a card.
Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery. This card enters the battlefield unattached and stays on the battlefield if the creature leaves.)

card.name: Spellbinder
card.ability:
Imprint — When Spellbinder enters the battlefield, you may exile an instant card from your hand.
Whenever equipped creature deals combat damage to a player, you may copy the exiled card. If you do, you may cast the copy without paying its mana cost.
Equip {4}
card.ruling:
12/1/2004 : Spellbinder's second ability allows you to create a copy of the imprinted Instant card in the Exile zone (that's where the imprinted Instant card is) and then cast it without paying its mana cost.
12/1/2004 : You don't pay the spell's mana cost. If the spell has X in its mana cost, X is 0. You do pay any additional costs for that spell. You can't use any alternative costs.
12/1/2004 : If the copied card is a split card, you choose which one side of it to cast, but you can't cast both sides. You can choose the other side later in the game, though.
12/1/2004 : Spellbinder imprints a card only once, when it enters the battlefield. Attaching Spellbinder to a creature doesn't trigger its enters-the-battlefield ability.
3/1/2005 : The creation of the copy and then the casting of the copy are both optional.

card.name: Spincrusher
card.ability:
Whenever Spincrusher blocks, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spincrusher: Spincrusher is unblockable this turn.
card.flavor: It rolls with the punches.

card.name: Spire Golem
card.ability:
Affinity for Islands (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each Island you control.)
Flying
card.flavor: The longer it soars above the shimmering swirls of the Quicksilver Sea, the more it adopts their unpredictability.

card.name: Stand Together
card.ability: Put two +1/+1 counters on target creature and two +1/+1 counters on another target creature.
card.flavor: Strange times make for strange allies.

card.name: Steelshaper Apprentice
card.ability: {W}, {T}, Return Steelshaper Apprentice to its owner's hand: Search your library for an Equipment card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: Theirs is a craft brought about by necessity, now raised to the level of art.

card.name: Stir the Pride
card.ability:
Choose one — Creatures you control get +2/+2 until end of turn; or until end of turn, creatures you control gain "Whenever this creature deals damage, you gain that much life."
Entwine {1}{W} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

card.name: Sundering Titan
card.ability: When Sundering Titan enters the battlefield or leaves the battlefield, choose a land of each basic land type, then destroy those lands.
card.ruling:
12/1/2004 : Sundering Titan's two abilities aren't targeted. When one of the abilities resolves, the Titan's controller must choose one land for each basic land type (Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest).
12/1/2004 : If one of the basic land types isn't present, it isn't chosen. If the only land of a certain type is one you control, you must choose it.
12/1/2004 : If a land has more than one basic land type, it can be chosen more than once.
12/1/2004 : All the chosen lands are destroyed simultaneously.

card.name: Surestrike Trident
card.ability:
Equipped creature has first strike and "{T}, Unattach Surestrike Trident: This creature deals damage equal to its power to target player."
Equip {4} ({4}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery. This card enters the battlefield unattached and stays on the battlefield if the creature leaves.)
card.ruling:
12/1/2004 : Surestrike Trident grants an ability to the equipped creature.
12/1/2004 : The equipped creature's controller chooses whether or not to activate the activated ability. It doesn't matter who controls Surestrike Trident.
12/1/2004 : "Unattach Surestrike Trident" means just that -- Surestrike Trident moves off the creature it was equipping and remains on the battlefield.

card.name: Sword of Fire and Ice
card.ability:
Equipped creature gets +2/+2 and has protection from red and from blue.
Whenever equipped creature deals combat damage to a player, Sword of Fire and Ice deals 2 damage to target creature or player and you draw a card.
Equip {2}

card.name: Sword of Light and Shadow
card.ability:
Equipped creature gets +2/+2 and has protection from white and from black.
Whenever equipped creature deals combat damage to a player, you gain 3 life and you may return up to one target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
Equip {2}

card.name: Synod Artificer
card.ability:
{X}, {T}: Tap X target noncreature artifacts.
{X}, {T}: Untap X target noncreature artifacts.
card.flavor: Memnarch shared a touch of his power with the vedalken in return for their service. It is a debt he intends to collect.

card.name: Talon of Pain
card.ability:
Whenever a source you control other than Talon of Pain deals damage to an opponent, put a charge counter on Talon of Pain.
{X}, {T}, Remove X charge counters from Talon of Pain: Talon of Pain deals X damage to target creature or player.

card.name: Tangle Golem
card.ability: Affinity for Forests (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each Forest you control.)
card.flavor: The longer it weaves through the twisted vines of the Tangle, the more it adopts their hidden strength.

card.name: Tangle Spider
card.ability:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
card.flavor: They're considered good luck by the elves they don't eat.

card.name: Tanglewalker
card.ability: Each creature you control is unblockable as long as defending player controls an artifact land.
card.flavor: In bringing life to Mirrodin, Memnarch was more successful than he knew—for Mirrodin began to take on a life of its own.

card.name: Tears of Rage
card.ability:
Cast Tears of Rage only during the declare attackers step.
Attacking creatures you control get +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is the number of attacking creatures. Sacrifice those creatures at the beginning of the next end step.

card.name: Tel-Jilad Outrider
card.ability: Protection from artifacts
card.flavor: "When the levelers come again, we shall be ready for them."

card.name: Tel-Jilad Wolf
card.ability: Whenever Tel-Jilad Wolf becomes blocked by an artifact creature, Tel-Jilad Wolf gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
card.flavor: Thanks to the wolves, Tel-Jilad is the one area of Mirrodin the myr don't see often.

card.name: Test of Faith
card.ability: Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn, and put a +1/+1 counter on that creature for each 1 damage prevented this way.
card.flavor: Those who survive the test bear a mark of power anyone can recognize.
card.ruling: 12/1/2004 : The +1/+1 counters are put onto the creature at the time the damage is prevented. If a 1/1 creature would be dealt 6 damage, 3 damage is prevented and three +1/+1 counters are put onto the creature. The creature is a 4/4 creature with 3 damage on it, so it won't be destroyed because State-Based Actions aren't checked until after Test of Faith is finished resolving.

card.name: Thought Dissector
card.ability: {X}, {T}: Target opponent reveals cards from the top of his or her library until an artifact card or X cards are revealed, whichever comes first. If an artifact card is revealed this way, put it onto the battlefield under your control and sacrifice Thought Dissector. Put the rest of the revealed cards into that player's graveyard.
card.ruling: 12/1/2004 : You put the artifact card onto the battlefield even if Thought Dissector has already left the battlefield and you can't sacrifice it.

card.name: Thunderstaff
card.ability:
As long as Thunderstaff is untapped, if a creature would deal combat damage to you, prevent 1 of that damage.
{2}, {T}: Attacking creatures get +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.ruling: 12/1/2004 : If Thunderstaff is untapped, it prevents 1 damage from each creature, each time it would deal combat damage to you. So if three creatures with double strike attack you and aren't blocked, Thunderstaff will prevent a total of 6 damage.

card.name: Trinisphere
card.ability: As long as Trinisphere is untapped, each spell that would cost less than three mana to cast costs three mana to cast. (Additional mana in the cost may be paid with any color of mana or colorless mana. For example, a spell that would cost {1}{B} to cast costs {2}{B} to cast instead.)
card.ruling:
12/1/2004 : Trinisphere's ability affects the total cost of the spell. It is applied *after* any other cost increasers or cost reducers are applied: First apply any cost increases. Next apply any cost reducers. Finally look at the amount of mana you have to pay. If it's less than three mana, you'll pay three mana.
12/1/2004 : Even with a cost reducer on the battlefield, spells can't cost less than three mana to cast.
12/1/2004 : If a spell costs at least three mana due to additional costs, such as kicker costs, that's fine.
12/1/2004 : You still need to pay any additional nonmana costs the spell has, such as sacrificing a creature or discarding cards.
12/1/2004 : Casting a creature with morph face down already costs three mana, even though the converted mana cost of the face-down spell is zero, so Trinisphere normally doesn't modify the total cost of a face-down creature spell. However, if Dream Chisel is reducing that cost while Trinisphere is on the battlefield, you'll still have to pay three mana for the spell.

card.name: Turn the Tables
card.ability: All combat damage that would be dealt to you this turn is dealt to target attacking creature instead.
card.flavor: "Your arrogance is my best weapon."
card.ruling:
12/1/2004 : If the targeted creature isn't on the battlefield when the combat damage would be dealt, the damage isn't redirected.
12/1/2004 : If the targeted creature has been removed from combat but is still on the battlefield, the damage will be redirected.

card.name: Unforge
card.ability: Destroy target Equipment. If that Equipment was attached to a creature, Unforge deals 2 damage to that creature.
card.flavor: Compared to the fire of the forge, the strength of steel is nothing.
card.ruling: 12/1/2004 : Unforge deals damage only to the creature that the Equipment was attached to when the Equipment was destroyed. It doesn't deal damage to creatures that the Equipment had previously equipped.

card.name: Ur-Golem's Eye
card.ability: {T}: Add {2} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: It still stares accusingly at Memnarch, though millennia have passed since he separated the eye from its body.

card.name: Vedalken Engineer
card.ability: {T}: Add two mana of any one color to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast artifact spells or activate abilities of artifacts.
card.flavor: Art is unknown to the vedalken—for them, all creations must serve a purpose.

card.name: Vex
card.ability: Counter target spell. That spell's controller may draw a card.
card.flavor:
"The druids would be better off if they spent more time in the lab and less time watching trees grow."
—Pontifex, elder researcher

card.name: Viridian Acolyte
card.ability: {1}, {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
card.flavor: "We have no sun to guide our dead, so I tend the prismatic flames of the spirit fires that show the souls their way. When I die, I hope there is one left to guide my spirit home."

card.name: Viridian Zealot
card.ability: {1}{G}, Sacrifice Viridian Zealot: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
card.flavor: "I will fight only the way nature intended—and nature intended us to win."

card.name: Voltaic Construct
card.ability: {2}: Untap target artifact creature.
card.flavor: The undead may outlast the living, but those who have never lived outlast them both.

card.name: Vulshok Morningstar
card.ability:
Equipped creature gets +2/+2.
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

card.name: Vulshok War Boar
card.ability: When Vulshok War Boar enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you sacrifice an artifact.
card.flavor: It must eat its weight in metal daily, or its furnacelike belly will consume itself for lack of fuel.

card.name: Wand of the Elements
card.ability:
{T}, Sacrifice an Island: Put a 2/2 blue Elemental creature token with flying onto the battlefield.
{T}, Sacrifice a Mountain: Put a 3/3 red Elemental creature token onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: It gives legs to the earth and wings to the sky.

card.name: Well of Lost Dreams
card.ability: Whenever you gain life, you may pay {X}, where X is less than or equal to the amount of life you gained. If you do, draw X cards.
card.flavor: Some say the knowledge lost during the Ritual of Rebuking is returned through the well's waters.

card.name: Whispersilk Cloak
card.ability:
Equipped creature is unblockable and has shroud.
Equip {2}

card.name: Wirefly Hive
card.ability: {3}, {T}: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, put a 2/2 colorless Insect artifact creature token with flying named Wirefly onto the battlefield. If you lose the flip, destroy all permanents named Wirefly.
card.flavor:
"The lifespan of a wirefly can be precisely described as ‘short.'"
—Bruenna, Neurok leader

card.name: Wurm's Tooth
card.ability: Whenever a player casts a green spell, you may gain 1 life.
card.flavor: A wurm knows nothing of deception. If it opens its mouth, it plans to eat you.
card.ruling:
10/1/2009 : The ability triggers whenever any player, not just you, casts a green spell.
10/1/2009 : If a player casts a green spell, Wurm's Tooth's ability triggers and is put on the stack on top of that spell. Wurm's Tooth's ability will resolve (causing you to gain 1 life) before the spell does.
